item.title: Setting up a blog with Hugo and Netlify
item.description: Hugo is a static site generator that claims to be the world’s fastest framework for building websites. I’ve used jekyll in the past to set up a quick blog but found it clunky to use and the build time to be quite slow. So far Hugo has been really easy to set up. (apart from a few issues getting Hugo installed on Ubuntu correctly) I’m loving the huge amount of themes to choose from and switch between.
